entry.title: Secret Service May Gain Expanded Powers To Address Crypto Crime Under New Bill
entry.summary:
US senators believe that the President’s bodyguards could do more than just wield high-powered pistols and don sleek dark glasses. The lawmakers have presented a measure that would give the Secret Service the power to look into and prosecute crimes using digital assets in a bipartisan effort.
Aimed at curbing the growing menace of illicit money and crypto use by criminals, the Combating Money Laundering in Cybercrime Act of 2024 has been proposed.
Specifics Of The Proposed Law
Sens. Amy Klobuchar (D-Minn.), Chuck Grassley (R-Iowa), and Catherine Cortez Masto (D-Nev.) introduced the bill, which would grant the Secret Service greater investigative powers to look into crimes involving digital assets, such as financial institution fraud, structured transitions, and unlicensed money tra…

entry.title: This Wall Street Bitcoin Miner Produced 63% Less BTC in July 2024
entry.summary: Publicly traded on Wall Street and the London Stock Exchange (LSE), Bitcoin (BTC) miner Argo Blockchain presented today (Monday) its latest report on cryptocurrency production for the month of July. The result of 48 mined BTC is over 60% worse than last year's figures, but shows a slight improvement compared to recent months. Much Less Bitcoin for Argo, but Comparable Revenue In July, Argo Blockchain mined 48 Bitcoins, translating to a production of 1.5 BTC per day. Compared to June, this result is 4 Bitcoins better, but significantly worse than last year. In July 2023, BTC production averaged 4.2 BTC per day, totaling 129 tokens. Despite such a significant drop in the number of Bitcoins mined, which is partly due to the increasing network difficulty and the April b…

entry.title: XRP Ledger Devs Outraged Over Edited Clip By Ripple: Here’s What Happened
entry.summary:
In a recent development that has sparked considerable outrage within the XRP Ledger (XRPL) developer community, Ripple is under fire for altering a podcast clip. The edited segment was part of Ripple’s new podcast series titled “Exploring Ripple’s New Stablecoin Ripple USD (RLUSD)”, featuring CTO David Schwartz and Ripple President Monica Long discussing the upcoming launch of the stablecoin and various aspects of the XRP Ledger ecosystem.
The controversy centers around a specific modification to a statement made by Monica Long. In the original podcast, Long noted the momentum of developer engagement on the XRP Ledger, stating, “We’ve put all of that effort in and ultimately it’s a bit chicken in the egg to get developer momentum on the XRP Ledger which we are seeing, there are already t…

entry.title: Federal Police Uncover Major Crypto Scam: 2,000 Aussie Wallets Hacked
entry.summary:
Over 2,000 Australian-owned crypto wallets discovered by the Australian Federal Police (AFP) have been hacked by foreign fraudsters, the Financial Review reported.
Part of a larger effort called Operation Spincaster, which seeks to fight cybercrime worldwide, this concerning find marks the latest accomplishment in the war against crypto crime.
Both the AFP and the Joint Policing Cybercrime Coordination Centre (JPC3), which collaborates with law enforcement agencies from other governments to curb digital fraud and scams, have been the driving forces behind this operation respectively.
Compromised Crypto Wallets Tied To Several Exchanges
Based on the report, the compromised digital wallets have ties to several crypto exchanges, though it did not disclose in detail the names of the …

entry.title: Here’s Why Bitcoin And Ethereum Price Crashed
entry.summary:
The cryptocurrency industry recently experienced a substantial reduction in its overall market capitalization as prices plummeted sharply over the weekend. This downturn was particularly notable as Bitcoin, the leading cryptocurrency by market value, fell below the $60,000 mark on Saturday, August 3. Ethereum, the second-largest cryptocurrency, also faced significant losses, dipping below $3,000 and reaching a low of $2,860. This caused other cryptocurrencies to follow suit, with most bleeding red immediately.
Such volatility is not uncommon within the crypto space, where prices often fluctuate dramatically in response to various factors. These price swings are typically driven by market reactions to recent news or events. In this instance, the latest price declines can be attributed …

Polymarket hits volume record of $20m. ETH ETFs will get steady capital: Binance CEO. Winklevii donate $1m to try and unseat Warren. Tornado sees $1.9bn volume resurgence. New overlay attacks growing in crypto. Messari co-founder faces backlash on views. Raydium integrates with Moonpay. Tencent leads investment round in Chainbase. ZA Bank partners with stablecoin issuers.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 161 - THE BIG WIF COMEBACK?
entry.summary: BTC ETF Inflows: +$53m. Crypto remains stable despite macro sell-off. ETH ETF providers undercut each other on fees. Grayscale keeps 2.5% high fee, launches mini-fund. Grayscale launches ‘Decentralised AI Fund’. Dimon may be ‘changing tune’ on Bitcoin. Many alts now bounced 50-90% from lows. Vote implies 55% of Mt. Gox depositors won’t sell. BlockFi to make creditor distributions this month. WazirX exchanges sees $230m suspected breach. Vitalik warns against voting ‘pro-crypto’. Vitalik & Autism Capital trade barbs. Bitcoin Magazine to hold pro-Trump fundraiser. State Street explore blockchain payments. UPbit sees 44% monthly drop in volume.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 160 - CHATTING TO ROBINHOOD!
entry.summary: BTC ETF Inflows: +$423m. Crypto pushes higher, biggest ETF inflow in 6 weeks. Mt. Gox FUD ‘overestimated’ as whales accumulate. Kraken to begin Mt. Gox repayments in 7-14d. ETH spot ETFs will push ETH to $5k: Bitwise. SOL ETF will be next: Bloomberg. XRP up 35% this week ahead of potential settlement. Aethir reports $36m H1 customer revenue. Craig Wright now under threat of perjury & forgery. FTX & CFTC in $12.7bn settlement. WLD up 40% after delaying unlock schedule. Helio announces instant crypto fiat commerce. Phantom pauses cross-chain swaps amid exploit.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 159 - MEMECOINS GO MAD!
entry.summary: BTC ETF Inflows: +$301m. BTC dips from $65k as $6bn moves from Mt. Gox. Coinbase & MicroStrategy surge with BTC. Genesis sells another $38m BTC. ETH ETF timeline delayed until July 23rd. Trump chooses crypto friendly Vance as VP. Old clip shows Vance bashing Gensler on crypto. Bitcoin is good during debasement: Larry Fink. Michael Dell calls Fink video ‘fascinating’. Fear & Greed index shifts to Greed. Tether mints $1bn USDT on Tron. Stripe expands crypto integration to the EU.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 158 - A WILD WEEKEND FOR BITCOIN
entry.summary: Trump response optimism takes BTC to $63K. Bitcoin whales accumulate most since April 2023. Trump still set to talk at Bitcoin Nashville. ETH ETF approval this week: Geraci. XRP vs SEC press conference rumoured on 18th. Crypto funds saw $1.44B inflows last week. Rumours China is to ‘unban BTC’ in Q4. S. Korea may delay crypto taxes until 2028. Russia to allow crypto trading on stock exchange. All altcoin categories outperform BTC over 7d. BitConnect infamous promoter convicted. Scroll becomes 8th L2 with TVL over $1bn. ETHFI Season 2 claims available this week. Base hits record 1m UserOps in a week.

entry.title: Zoltan Istvan on AI and Human Immortality
entry.summary: Transhumanist Party founder Zoltan Istvan chats with Decrypt's Emerging Technology report Jason Nelson about his journey with transhumanism, running for office, and why he fears AI is outpacing life science and poses a threat to the quest for immortality.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 157 - ROLLBIT FRIDAY!
entry.summary: The German state sells $2bn+ BTC and has under $300m left. BTC ETF sees $800M of inflows, Mr 100 keeps buying. SOL ETF deadline set for 2025, election could be key. SOL stablecoin TVL soars on Tether & PYUSD growth. Firedancer sees the first accepted block on SOL testnet. ETH ETFs finally expected next week. Monthly active crypto addresses top 100m. Trump to speak at Bitcoin Nashville conference. Golman Sachs to launch 3 tokenization projects. Short squeeze in altcoins sees TIA rise 80% from lows. MOG leads top memes coins, BONK flips WIF. Farming interest shifts to Berachain & Monad.
